content.description:
Start in an obvious hueco just to the left of Magikarp. Use a few movements to get from two left crimps until your right hand is in the other undercling. Throw up to a sloping side pull, then up to the jug horn. Finish by staying right (but not all the way right onto the sloper for Magikarp) and throw desperately for the top.

REMEMBER DON'T BAIL OUT TO THE LEFT ONTO THE LEDGE!
content.protection: Probably 3 boulder pads at least. There's a gross rock right under the route and you definitely want that covered.
content.location: Just to the left of Magikarp.

content.description: Super awesome route. One of my favorite at Garth. Starts low and leads from awesome jugs and to wild slopers.

What started as a goofy V-Silly turned into an exquisitely abrasive natural arch bear hug with more than it's fair share of heel hooks and a sweet 180 to top it all off!

Start on the south side of the Boulder with a pair of inviting judge slopers.  Then move up and towards right, traversing the top edge of the natural arch. Don't be shy with the heel hooking as you swing through the arch to the lip on the other side. More creative feet and a 180 brings you to the final mantle move and top out.

Remember, just because the ground (or flat boulder dish) is right below you doesn't mean that you can use it. Ground=lava
content.protection: Crash pad, at least for the first handful of moves
content.location: Starts on the south side of Misty Boulder just to the left of the big arch.
